title: How to Make Cream Cheese Mints Using Frosting

steps.headline: Mix together the cream cheese, half and half and butter in a heavy bottomed saucepan.
On low heat, stir the ingredients until the mixture is soft and creamy.
steps.description: Be sure that the butter is melted.

steps.headline: Add the frosting to the cream cheese mixture and blend well.
Add the peppermint extract and the food coloring of your choice.
steps.description: If you want, divide the cream cheese mixture into even parts and apply different coloring to them.

steps.headline: Roll the mixture into balls or drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper-lined cookie sheets.
Press down with a fork or find another means to stamp the mints.
steps.description: If you don't want to do that, just flatten them.

steps.headline: Allow the mints to stand, uncovered, at room temperature until they are firm and the outside is dry.

text: Mix together the cream cheese, half and half and butter in a heavy bottomed saucepan.  On low heat, stir the ingredients until the mixture is soft and creamy. Be sure that the butter is melted. Add the frosting to the cream cheese mixture and blend well.  Add the peppermint extract and the food coloring of your choice. If you want, divide the cream cheese mixture into even parts and apply different coloring to them. Roll the mixture into balls or drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper-lined cookie sheets.  Press down with a fork or find another means to stamp the mints. If you don't want to do that, just flatten them. Allow the mints to stand, uncovered, at room temperature until they are firm and the outside is dry.  Finished.
